mods.abstract: $50 Reward. RUNAWAY from the subscriber, living about thirteen miles west of Shreveport, on Sunday, the 6th inst., TWO NEGRO BOYS, named JOHN and JIM, John is about 22 years old, 5 feet 8 or 9 nine inches high, rather full mouth, low forehead, and quick spoken. Jim is a low, chunky boy, about 24 years old, is in the habit of wearing his hair plaited; has the end of his forefinger off, and turns his toes out when walking. They had with them a small valise, and were seen on Sunday evening in the vicinity of Shreveport. Any person returning them to my possession will receive the above reward, or $25 for either of them. E. M. COLEMAN. Shreveport, July 9. 1856-tf
mods.note: Louisiana State University Libraries, Special Collections ( http://www.lib.lsu.edu/special )
mods.accessCondition: E-mail lsudiglib@lsu.edu with questions or comments about the collection.

Physical rights are retained by the LSU Libraries. Copyright has expired and the item is therefore in the public domain. Permission to reproduce this image must be requested through the Special Collections Department, Louisiana State University Libraries.
mods.note: Louisiana Runaway Slave Advertisements, 1836-1865, Louisiana Digital Library, Baton Rouge, La.
